main event: On 7th May 1958, three blush-white triangular objects, similar to stars, were observed hovering and then fading from sight over Fresno, California, heading towards San Francisco. The observation lasted for approximately 3 hours.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 3 hours, providing a prolonged observation of the objects.
The objects were described as stationary and triangular, similar to stars, before they disappeared from view.
The conclusion of the sighting was that it was probably a balloon, but there were also indications that it possibly could have been a balloon.
Other commercial airliners in the same area also reported seeing the same objects, adding credibility to the sighting.
The handwritten note at the end attributed the faintness of the objects to Venus and Argus, indicating a celestial explanation for the sighting.
result: potentially explained as balloons, but with some uncertainty
sighted object: three blush-white triangular objects similar to stars
location: Fresno, California, heading towards San Francisco
witnesses: pilots of commercial airliners and an Air Force officer interested in the case
